titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the 3:16 Bible Texts Illuminated
titlestmt.author: Daniel Hartwig

publicationstmt.publisher: Department of Special Collections and University Archives

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit

did.head: Overview
did.abstract: Collection includes Knuth's research notes, drafts of the manuscript and readers' comments, correspondence with Hermann Zapf, artistic co-worker, correspondence with illustrators and publishers, artwork, proofs, and "exabyte" computer tapes of the artwork, text, and fonts used in the book. Also included is correspondence, exhibit texts and records, photographs, ephemera, financial records, and clippings, 1991-1996, pertaining to the traveling exhibit of artwork from the book, designed and organized by Jennifer S. Knuth.

repository.label: Repository:
repository.corpname: Department of Special Collections and University Archives

acqinfo.p: Gift of Donald E. Knuth, 1991 and 1996.

accessrestrict.head: Information about Access
accessrestrict.p: This collection is open for research.

userestrict.head: Ownership & Copyright
userestrict.p: All requests to reproduce, publish, quote from, or otherwise use collection materials must be submitted in writing to the Head of Special Collections and University Archives, Stanford University Libraries, Stanford, California 94304-6064. Consent is given on behalf of Special Collections as the owner of the physical items and is not intended to include or imply permission from the copyright owner. Such permission must be obtained from the copyright owner, heir(s) or assigns. See: http://library.stanford.edu/depts/spc/pubserv/permissions.html.
Restrictions also apply to digital representations of the original materials. Use of digital files is restricted to research and educational purposes.

prefercite.head: Cite As
prefercite.p: 3:16 Bible Texts Illuminated (SC0399). Dept. of Special Collections and University Archives, Stanford University Libraries, Stanford, Calif.

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical Sketch
bioghist.p: Professor of computer science at Stanford University.

scopecontent.head: Description of the Collection
scopecontent.p: Collection includes Knuth's research notes, drafts of the manuscript and readers' comments, correspondence with Hermann Zapf, artistic co-worker, correspondence with illustrators and publishers, artwork, proofs, and "exabyte" computer tapes of the artwork, text, and fonts used in the book. Also included is correspondence, exhibit texts and records, photographs, ephemera, financial records, and clippings, 1991-1996, pertaining to the traveling exhibit of artwork from the book, designed and organized by Jennifer S. Knuth.

did.unittitle: First computer output of Old Testament portion.
First computer output of New Testament portion.
Comments by Rev. Norman Pfotenhauer and Rev. Jon Dechow.
Comments by David Shewmake, Tom Leep.
Comments by Guy Steele Jr, Ken Rietz, Dan McCracken.
Comments by R.F. Gray, R.W. Howell, R. Gundry.
Xeroxes of calligraphy (working index to illustrations)
Letters from Knuth to calligraphers and readers.
Letters to Knuth received just after publication.
Original MS notes for Bible class given in 1978.
Laserprinted reference set of illustration plates.
Notebook from experiments at Adobe Systems, Inc.

note.p: These are so-called "exabyte tapes," containing millions of bytes of "precious data" although they are very small. The first two tapes were made at Adobe Systems in 1989; they contain information from artwork as originally scanned into digital form before editing.

The third tape contains files in the PostScript language that will generate all 139 plates of illustrations used in the book. It also contains files in the TeX language that will generate the complete text, and files in the METAFONT language that will produce the special fonts used. It also contains records of correspondence with the artists and the labels used in a traveling exhibit of calligraphy constructed from the artwork for this book.

note.p: Contains various sketches and layouts by the artists, and also includes original art work by Veljovic', Wadisherla, Kot, Schneider, Jackson, Peter, Hoefer, Bernd, Zapf, Zigany.
Contains the following, from bottom to top:

did.unittitle: Plates from sample chapter printed at Nimrod Press, Boston, 1986.
Plates from exhibition brochure printed at Slonaker's, Palo Alto, 1989.
Hermann Zapf's original layout for the poster, January 1990.
Proofs of the poster, Singapore, October-November 1990.
Signatures printed on illustration side only.
Sample covers at press time, showing significant color variation.
Sample signatures at press time, showing significant color variation.

note.p: This addition to the collection pertains to the traveling exhibit of artwork from the book, designed and organized by Jennifer S. Knuth. Included are correspondence, exhibit texts and records, photographs, ephemera, financial records, and clippings. There are also some financial records and other materials pertaining to the production of the book.
